Article.Abstract: Listeriolysin O (LLO) mediates the evasion of Listeria monocytogenes from the phagolysosome into the cytoplasm of the host cell. The recognition of infected cells by CD4 T cells is thought to be limited by the evasion of bacteria from the phagolysosome and also by the direct LLO-mediated inhibition of CD4 T cell activation. To analyze the influence of these immunoevasive mechanisms on the antilisterial CD4 T cell response, the expansion of L. monocytogenes-specific CD4 and CD8 T cells was monitored in infected mice. It was found that expansion of L. monocytogenes-specific CD4 T cells occurred synchronously with CD8 T cell expansion. The analysis of Ag presentation by macrophages and dendritic cells isolated from spleens of infected mice revealed efficient presentation of L. monocytogenes-derived CD4 T cell epitopes that was not dependent on the actA-mediated intercellular spread of bacteria. The further in vitro Ag presentation analysis revealed that although L. monocytogenes-infected macrophages and dendritic cells were poor presenters of CD4 T cell epitopes, more efficient presentation occurred after cocultivation of noninfected dendritic cells or macrophages with infected cells. These data indicate that the suppressive effect of LLO on the antilisterial CD4 T cell response is maintained only in infected APC and support the hypothesis that cross-priming plays a role in the induction of the strong CD4 T cell response in Listeria-infected mice.
Article.ArticleTitle: Cross-presentation of Listeria monocytogenes-derived CD4 T cell epitopes.
Article.Affiliations: Institut für Medizinische Mikrobiologie und Hygiene, Fakultät für Klinische Medizin Mannheim der Universität Heidelberg, Mannheim, Germany.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Bacterial Toxins;Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;Heat-Shock Proteins;Hemolysin Proteins;Histocompatibility Antigens Class I;Histocompatibility Antigens Class II;Peptide Fragments;hlyA protein, Listeria monocytogenes
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Animals; Bacterial Toxins; CD4-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); Dendritic Cells(microbiology; physiology); Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte; Female; Heat-Shock Proteins(immunology); Hemolysin Proteins; Histocompatibility Antigens Class I(physiology); Histocompatibility Antigens Class II(physiology); Listeria monocytogenes(immunology); Mice; Mice, Inbred Strains; Peptide Fragments(immunology)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Previously shown to be a CD4 (MHC II) restricted epitope. Protein name stands for Listeriolysin O precursor. Also known as Thiol-activated cytolysin.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -T cell subset identification

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes were harvested 10 days after the 2nd immunization and IFNg production was measured. BALB/c and C57BL/6 x BALB/c F1 mice also produced IFNg in response to this peptide. The stimulation of CD4 cells is synchronous with CD8 stimulation, implying that CD4 responses are seen despite intracellular localization of the source species.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Previously shown to be a CD4 (MHC II) restricted epitope. Protein name stands for Listeriolysin O precursor. Also known as Thiol-activated cytolysin.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: innoculation with 10<sup>3</sup> CFU of bacteria, 14 days later CD4+ T cell line was established form splenocytes.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: P388 where infected in vitro with Listeria monocytogenes and used as source of antigen for cross presentation.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -T cell subset identification

AssayInformation.AssayComments: T cell line specific for this peptide is unable to respond to DC infected with listeria (Fig 5A), but when macrophage-like P388 cells are infected and incubated with DC from naïve mice, cross presentation occurs and T cell stimulation is seen, circumventing the LLO-mediated blocking of class II-restricted Ag presentation. This effect is not dependent on apoptotic effect of Listeria, nor on Ag presentation by primary infected APCs (Figs 7 to 9). P388 macrophage-like cells (H2-&supd;) infected with Listeria for 18 h, DC or macrophages from naïve H-2&supb; C57BL/6 mice were added and peptide specific T cell line (H2&supb;, syngeneic with DC) was assayed for IFN-g production.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -T cell subset identification

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes were harvested 10 days after the 2nd immunization and IFNg production was measured. BALB/c and C57BL/6 x BALB/c F1 mice also produced IFNg in response to this peptide. The stimulation of CD4 cells is synchronous with CD8 stimulation, implying that CD4 responses are seen despite intracellular localization of the source species.
